other_tests.findings: Edematous bone marrow with clusters of plasma cells and mild predominance of macrophages, mast cells, and lymphocytes, consistent with chronic inflammation. Negative cultures.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially a fast response to indomethacin with involution of the mandibular lesion, but there was a recurrence once the medication was stopped.

other_tests.findings: Revealed additional lesions in the right acetabulum, proximal left tibial metaphysis, and bilateral distal tibia.
Confirmed diagnosis of severe ulcerative colitis.
Showed a sheet of bone with an irregular appearance, dense acute inflammation, and negative cultures.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two CT scans throughout treatment showed marked improvement in the size of the mandibular lesion.

other_tests.findings: No inflammatory infiltrate, acute or chronic, and remodeling changes of the bone.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Dramatic improvement in radiographic results after maintenance indomethacin treatment.

other_tests.findings: Initially showed ground-glass lesion with areas of sclerosis and osteolysis; follow-up showed significant reduction in mandibular angle thickness and sclerosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Significant decrease in overall thickness and sclerosis after treatment; there were no new lytic lesions or periosteal reactions.
